question: Question_05_(d)
statement:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing
the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

\[P = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\
\frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

\textbf{(d)} Each set below contains the absolute values of the
eigenvalues of either \emph{P} or \emph{(1/2)P + (1/2)Q}. Check your
guess for which list is which below and give a reason for your choice.

\emph{\{1.00, 0.42, 0.19, 0.19, 0.10, 0.25} are the values: for \emph{P}
❏, for \emph{(1/2)P + (1/2)Q} ❏

\emph{\{1.00, 0.85, 0.38, 0.38, 0.21, 0.50} are the values: for \emph{P}
❏, for \emph{(1/2)P + (1/2)Q} ❏
